name: Vegan Peanut Butter Pie
description: Vegan Peanut Butter Pie - it's magically creamy, fluffy, and so peanut buttery. Made with only 6 ingredients, this no-bake delight couldn't be easier to make!

recipeIngredient: 8 ounce package vegan cream cheese (I used tofutti brand)
9 ounce package So Delicious Coco Whip* (see notes for options)

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Place the Oreo cookies in a blender or food processor, and pulse until they are fine crumbs. Dump the crumbs into a large bowl, then add the melted vegan butter and stir until the crumbs are moistened, but still crumbly.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Place the Oreo cookies in a blender or food processor, and pulse until they are fine crumbs. Dump the crumbs into a large bowl, then add the melted vegan butter and stir until the crumbs are moistened, but still crumbly.

itemListElement.text: Press the crumbs into a 9 inch pie pan, and bake for 7 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool completely before filling.
itemListElement.name: Press the crumbs into a 9 inch pie pan, and bake for 7 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool completely before filling.

itemListElement.text: In a large bowl with a hand mixer (or stand mixer using the whisk attachment) beat the peanut butter and cream cheese until smooth. Now add the powdered sugar and beat in. Lastly, add the package of coconut whipped cream and beat until combined and smooth.
itemListElement.name: In a large bowl with a hand mixer (or stand mixer using the whisk attachment) beat the peanut butter and cream cheese until smooth. Now add the powdered sugar and beat in. Lastly, add the package of coconut whipped cream and beat until combined and smooth.

itemListElement.text: Pour the peanut butter filling into the cooled cookie crust, and spread it out evenly with a spatula or spoon.
itemListElement.name: Pour the peanut butter filling into the cooled cookie crust, and spread it out evenly with a spatula or spoon.

itemListElement.text: Chill for at least a few hours, if possible, before slicing and serving. The longer it chills, the more firm the pie will be when you cut it. If you don't mind a softer pie, you can eat it after an hour.
itemListElement.name: Chill for at least a few hours, if possible, before slicing and serving. The longer it chills, the more firm the pie will be when you cut it. If you don't mind a softer pie, you can eat it after an hour.

itemListElement.text: You can serve it as is, or add some additional toppings. I added a layer of coco whip, a drizzle of vegan chocolate sauce (this brand, or use my chocolate ganache recipe), melted peanut butter and some chopped vegan peanut butter cups!
